TypeSignature.Value: public delegate bool SyncUpdateCallback(SyncFromAllServersEvent eventType, string targetServer, string sourceServer, SyncFromAllServersOperationException exception);
.class public auto ansi sealed SyncUpdateCallback extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: One of the members that specifies the type of event.
Contains the DNS name of the server that is the target of the replication. This parameter will be if it is not used by the notification.
Contains the DNS name of the server that is the source of the replication. This parameter will be if it is not used by the notification.
A object that contains additional information about any error that has occurred. This parameter will be if no error has occurred.
Docs.summary: Receives event notifications during a replica synchronization.
Docs.returns: if the SyncReplicaFromAllServers method invoked on a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ADAMInstance>, or object should resume; if the SyncReplicaFromAllServers method should terminate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController.SyncReplicaFromAllServers%2A>
operation takes a long time to complete and potentially could fail on a server. The SyncUpdateCallback callback function enables the application to indicate whether the SyncReplicaFromAllServers method should continue executing. For example, the application could return false to terminate <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer.SyncReplicaFromAllServers%2A>
execution if an error occurs. Another scenario in which this capability would be used is to terminate <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer.SyncReplicaFromAllServers%2A>
execution once the application detects that synchronization has completed for a certain target server or source server pair.
